website_summaries.verdict: SOS Food Labs makes dense bars that taste better than most.
pros: The cinnamon and coconut flavor is tasty, and the texture is similar to that of a crumbly cookie
Could even be suitable as a topping for yogurt or oatmeal
cons: The sugar content is high – not ideal for an emergency food supply

customer_reviews.title: Kind of tastes like dry, raw, cookie dough.
customer_reviews.text: I got the coconut and cinnamon sos bars the taste is not so bad, but they're so small. I'm doing the 3 day challenge just eating sos bars. I gotta say I'm still very hungry its alright for an emergency situation I would give it a try-you never know when you might be in tight spot.
customer_reviews.author: Moses

customer_reviews.title: Not for health nuts
customer_reviews.text: I’ve seen the reviews, these are not healthy. Look, these are survival bars. High calorie to keep moving if lost on a hike or possibly for cheap prepping (patriot sells them in bulk 100 bucks for 30 days). I bought these because I couldn’t stand the lemon taste of the other bars. Although, again, we didn’t buy for taste, we buy to survive. My show made 3/20, expires 3/25. Came fresh and airtight seal. See my pic.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Sugar content dangerously HIGH
customer_reviews.text: Had I been made aware of the HIGH sugar content of these bars I never would have purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Diane H

customer_reviews.title: Alas, couldn't see the ingredients clearly before I bought these.
customer_reviews.text: 31 Grams of SUGAR? Palm oil, Corn starch, Wheat gluten.... I was looking for a high calorie bar- but HEALTHY- these have such toxic ingredients. Alas, not returnable... Had to throw them out. SIGH!
customer_reviews.author: Honeygirl

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A HEALTH BAR
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people are complaining that these are unhealthy. These are not health bars, they’re survival rations. They’re designed to have a high calorie to weight ratio and be shelf stable. I like the packaging, very air/water tight, and they taste fine, would be happy to have something sweet in a survival situation. Look elsewhere for health food.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Samuels

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Packaged
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival, the two packages of bars appeared to be in order, except one of them had been broken up and appeared to have air INSIDE the sealed package. It looks like the bars are sealed, but either it was poorly vacuumed and allowed a good bit of air inside, or the bars are undergoing some reaction where they are giving off gas. Either way, only one of the two packages will be usable, as the one in the loose, poorly vacuumed package can't be trusted.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: The bars were moldy when I opened the coconut pack ...
customer_reviews.text: The bars were moldy when I opened the coconut pack. That's the only problem with purchasing food rations as you'll never know what's inside until you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Nuggins

customer_reviews.title: Honest, open review!
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to doing reviews I am honest of the evaluation. Prior to ordering this product I researched through articles reviews, YouTube views of multiple products of similar to this. I find that this product has been accurate with their claims. 1)S.O.S flavor is favorable to the palate, 2) Does not induce thirst while consuming 3) very filling 4) individual wrapped bars perfect for single use without spoiling remainer. 5) compact for storage in limited space I was actually impressed and will continue to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa P.

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum seal failure in 1 out of the 4 packs.
customer_reviews.text: 1 pack looks like it has a seal failure. I don't see any punctures or tears in the packaging. This will probably reduce the shelf life if the bar is not already compromised. Working with seller for a replacement. Will update. Update 03/26/2020 Shipped me a replacement without hassle. Packages seem to be vacuum sealed pretty good. No noticeable signs of rips/tears. Hassle free and prompt problem resolution. Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Skippy

customer_reviews.title: It comes as a sticky brick.
customer_reviews.text: The standard flavor was packaged for extended storage and individually wrapped for short term storage. The cinnamon flavor was a brick. The extended storage wrapper gets destroyed in the opening process no matter how careful you are. The bars are not short term individually wrapped and using a butter knife to separate them , they crumble. Then you need alternative ziplock bags to save them.
customer_reviews.author: picocycle

customer_reviews.title: You get two coconut ones.. I didn’t get cinnamon
customer_reviews.text: This’s good to have with you in case of an emergency.. But I got two coconut ones :( no cinnamon :( .. I ordered It because of the cinnamon one.. also the sugar content on this bars is pretty high, which is not good.. and have in mind there’s no return on this! but I guess this’s something of good value just in case of an emergency 🚨 Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: BDePeace

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted and delivered in less than 22 hrs!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my order's prompt delivery, at my door in less than 22 hrs. Picture shows production dates as recent as two weeks ago. Only way to get it any fresher is to pull it right off the production line. Vacuum seal intact, no damage to the packaging. For those complaining about taste or texture; it's FUEL people! It's meant to keep you alive not provide you with a fine dining experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite MRE for emergency earthquake kit
customer_reviews.text: I mean, it's an MRE. The taste is palatable and is quite dense as you can imagine. Just ordered my second batch because the ones we had in our earthquake kit expired 7 years ago, so, even with a long shelf life of about five years, these things tasted okay 7 years after the fact. But don't you do it, kids, keep your products fresh and replace as necessary. Keep in mind, that the ENTIRE PACKAGE of 9 bars equals 3600 calories. The individual bars are 410 calories each, high carb, fairly high sugar, low fiber, and adequate protein for emergency situations.
customer_reviews.author: M Something

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I buy these to keep in my emergency bag in my car, and I also keep a few in the house. I don't backpack and I think at 1.66 lbs. each, they would be pretty heavy. I'm not concerned much about the taste because, in my case, if I'm eating them it's because something bad has happened. I think these were a good value and came very fresh (Both MFG. late 2019 with an expiration of 2024). Packaging is very good! Let's face it, these are really designed for survival and for their shelf life .
customer_reviews.author: Nick Goudoras

customer_reviews.title: make sure the package is sealed tight
customer_reviews.text: one of my ration packages was sealed incorrectly I guess, because one was sealed tight as a drum and the other had air in it so it must of had a pinhole in it from??? It arrived this way. Did not throw away, just used a seal-a-meal and made individual packets.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Wow holly cow!
customer_reviews.text: The cinnimon actually tastes good. Just like a dry desert bar mom makes! I'll update this review when i try the coconut flav. I will be buying more. And letting all my friends try them. These are VERY solid. And dense. Fairly small but heavy.. The directions/instructions aren't grammatically correct so it attempts to make a statement about nutrition but it just doesnt make any sense. I'll update with pics and the exact phrase later when i update this review.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyRottenAppleSeed

customer_reviews.title: Fine for when it counts
customer_reviews.text: Bought two sets both coconut had a bad seal. AMAZON replaced one set. This is not a food to store for zombies and the end of the world this is a survival ration tobkeep you alive along enough for someone to find you. Since you can live several weeks without food it is to keep you organs from shutting down. But without water it dosent matter. Do not buy this as a health thing and thats all your going robeat for months as zombies come by. Both for a quick get some energy to keep it going it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Micah A. Young

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a get home bag!
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled to find a long term solution to food in my 72 hour get home bag. My bag is stored in my vehicle and the temperatures can get high. These bars are the perfect solution! I haven't opened them yet but the packaging looks great! The bars are vacuumed sealed and I haven't opened them so I can't attest to flavor, but seriously, flavor comes in a distant third after caloric value and shelf life. This was just the product I needed to complete my 72 hour get home bag!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn N.

customer_reviews.title: Good tasting Emergency snacks!
customer_reviews.text: These are actually really good! Ricey, cookie crumble tasting. That was just a week back, the pack I had for my BOB was about to expire so I opened them up and my family & I ate some. Fresh still, good flavor I thot. My wife and one son didn’t esp like them. My other son said these are good! I agreed! We both were in the Army, maybe that had something to do with liking K rations too. Haaaa I guarantee you if the pooo 💩 ever hits the fan after a couple days my wife n son will be gulping them down!!! (These were also at the 5 yr shelf limit!) still good!
customer_reviews.author: SpikeO

customer_reviews.title: Replace expired items in your emergency bag
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product as a replacement for some expired DATREX MRE packages in an emergency bag we have never had occasion to use. After watching a UTube video where people compared ease of use, cost and flavor the SOS rations rated well in all three areas. We haven’t eaten any yet and will only do so if the need arises. I hope they will serve us well if and when we do need them. These have a 5 year shelf life according to package instructions. We thought the two flavors would give us a bit of variety.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great taste . great source of energy. For great price
customer_reviews.text: I used this and put myself on a 4 day test only water and bars. Lost 10lbs no hunger pains or tired. Very very awesome product to carry in car purse or anywhere you go. From hiking to your morning run. Next challange 30day of the bars and water.. In September 2020.
customer_reviews.author: ALBERTO B.

customer_reviews.title: Made this very month and good for 5 years.
customer_reviews.text: Very well packaged and I might open one package to try them out. I was just replacing what had gone out of date but I am happy to see that they are even better packaged and variety in Flavor. I would actually use these to supplement the Freeze dried food that has an even longer self life.
customer_reviews.author: Magnus

customer_reviews.title: Purposely starving yourself to taste ration will satisfying flavor
customer_reviews.text: I've had the coconut before and it is pretty good by itself... obviously it's better to have a little bit of warm water so you can make like a cream of wheat, but in an extreme situation we both know you're not going to have time to warm up water so the bar by itself is satisfactory and sustainable I hope the cinnamon is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Come with nearly whole shelf life remaining!
customer_reviews.text: These came as advertised, and had 58/60 months of shelf life remaining. I have not tried them yet as they are for my Earthquake preparedness bags but i assume they are fine. Will update if i use them haha. They are well sealed, not too large and exactly what was advertised. I am happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Doerr

customer_reviews.title: Package not secure, taste awful, inconsistent... so... don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, I got regular ones, individually wrapped. They tasted awful, but they were preserved. Now the other pack was cinnamon. They were disgusting and tasted of cinnamon oil on flour and the outside packaging was ripped while inside they were all smashed together and not individually packaged. It was a bad experience overall. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Emmie

customer_reviews.title: Coconut is just the regular
customer_reviews.text: I tried the regular bars in the past and didn't really like the bland flavor. I decided to buy the Cinnamon + Coconut to test out before I bought bulk. The Cinnamon was actually pretty good but when I opened the ''Coconut'' one I was disappointed because it was just the Original bar. You could save money by buying the Cinnamon and Regular SOS bars through 2 different orders.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P

customer_reviews.title: just as discribed
customer_reviews.text: They are not individually sealed. package was in date and vacuum sealed. Taste great!!
customer_reviews.author: Toni Threadgill

customer_reviews.title: Received 2 of the same item
customer_reviews.text: I was under the impression that I would receive 1 Coconut and 1 Cinnamon pack. Image depicts Cinnamon and Coconut "S.O.S. Rations Emergency 3600 Calorie Food Bar (Cinnamon + Coconut, 2 Pack) " "Size Cinnamon + Coconut " "Included Components ONE BAR CINNAMON 1 BAR COCONUT " Multiple reviews talking about a cinnamon pack What was delivered is 2 Coconut packs. I'm honestly sorry that I'm giving this 5 stars, the product itself is very good, but it's that this particular listing failed me.
customer_reviews.author: Rungnisnev

customer_reviews.title: Lots of calories in a small package
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed when I got the Food Bar package was how heavy it was. This is a lot of very dense calories. There's one package of cinnamon and one of coconut. Each package has 6 bars in it. I opened them to taste and repackaged the left over bars in a vacuum seal bag to keep them fresh, though I probably wouldn't need to. The flavor is surprisingly okay. I expected them to be awful but they are kind of tasty, if a bit dry. Not candy bars but not bad. I'll get a few more of these to have around for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McKeeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I cant say about the flavor as I plan to keep it for emergency's. But the packaging is top shelf. I looked at other brands and decided that this one was the best choice for me. After 3 or 4 years in a hot car I'll test it and see how it fairs.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Mostly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Only received one package not 2 ? Outer plastic was damaged not sure of its shelf life now ?
customer_reviews.author: Jimnic26

customer_reviews.title: 2nd package purchased
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a package of these to keep in my truck - in case of emergencies. The expiration date on the first package was coming due, so I decided to eat them. Taste was good, It's not like Red Lobster quality food. But it would help in keeping you alive. So I purchased a 2nd package of them.
customer_reviews.author: Danny L. McElvain

customer_reviews.title: Emergency rations what can I say
customer_reviews.text: I am revising my rating downwards. These are much too high in sugar in my opinion. They will give you a "jolt" of energy due to the high sugar so you might consider these as a small part of your emergency plan, but there are much better options with much less sugar. I used a full pack of these so I can testify as to the "jolt" followed by a bit of a crash. Strictly my opinion as to how the bars effected me. Your results might be different of course
customer_reviews.author: Terry Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: great for emergency use
customer_reviews.text: these are awesome and taste decent. each portion is individually wrapped and are great to keep handy for any situation. buy a box of them keep them in your closet /car/boat/attic. make sure you note the expiration date and condition of the package. I love these!
customer_reviews.author: Carl J. Derossi

customer_reviews.title: SERVES THE PURPOSE
customer_reviews.text: Tastes just okay. Not pleased with the high sugar content and low vitamin content. Individually wrapped and sturdy packaging is great. The bottom line is that they will keep you alive during an emergency even if you have no electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Leah  B.

customer_reviews.title: Not a snack bar - meant to get you alive in a serious life threatening situation
customer_reviews.text: These are an excellent choice for emergency survival food. Those of you who are concerned about the amount of sugar or who are concerned with their figure are NOT in a survival situation. These never were for energy bars or snacks.
customer_reviews.author: Brent G

customer_reviews.title: thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I'll assume the flavor is good, didnt open, just placed in emergency go bag. Compact so it fit well
customer_reviews.author: Tyler G

customer_reviews.title: Stores well even in the trunk of a car.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to store in the car for emergencies. Lasts up to 5 years. A quick way to insure you have something to tide you over if you are stranded or have car trouble. I purchased these to replace a packet I used while out working in a remote location. They came in handy so I didn't have to repack everything into the car and go into town to grab something to eat. They are not a gourmet dinner, but will get you by and keep you from starving in unexpected situations. They also serve as a quick breakfast when you are in a hurry and need something easy and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Great product but vacuum seals on 2 packs didn't survive shipping
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum seal on 2 packets did not survive shipping... Great product for emergency situations, they are like cookies/crackers for my kids. But 2 of my packets are useless for long term storage now.
customer_reviews.author: Chuckychuck

customer_reviews.title: a perfect get out of town ration  or squirrel stash
customer_reviews.text: these are a good I density ration for several purposes you could think of these like buying gold or silver .
customer_reviews.author: Brent H.

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Packaging - As others have mentioned
customer_reviews.text: The package, when sealed properly is great. Compact, DENSE, and thick with two c's. But there was a pinhole in my package which broke the vacuum on the white package. Have to throw out as there is no return policy for food items. Shame. Kept the other.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: must to have
customer_reviews.text: UNFORTUNATELY the world we live in is such that an emergency food supply is a must to have item of any household nowadays, and this product is definitely something to consider!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ross

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not these actually taste good. For it's size and weight you can't beat it for 3 days worth of food. Be warned though. They are very dry, you will need alot of water when consuming them.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Catron

customer_reviews.title: Tasty backup
customer_reviews.text: Without question the most palatable emergency rations I have tasted. As described, they are for emergencies, not a casual snack. If you should get stuck somewhere without food in your near future, these are a great thing to have.
customer_reviews.author: arborista

customer_reviews.title: Very Tasty and Fresh
customer_reviews.text: Received my ordered quicker than promised. The manufactured date was the same month of purchase and they are good for 5 years. We opened them both and tasted them to see how the family would react. Very delicious. I HATE all things coconut and I love these. They do taste like a sweet graham cracker pie crust. They don't make you thirsty and go very well with coffee 😉. I'll be buying more to add to our emergency hurricane preparedness kit.
customer_reviews.author: txacman

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Got all coconut but thats great because I love coconut. Tastes like hard shortbread, very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good to have on hand in car and your emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my emergency bag and they are perfect for that use. I haven't tasted them yet but I feel good knowing they have a 5 year shelf life, and they pack a lot of calories without taking up a lot of space. Good addition to my emergency bag. Fast service and delivery too. They seem to be vegan friendly ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Went directly into my bug out bag. Excellent water proof packaging. Taste not rated since I didn't try them because they will only be used for an emergency. My only complaint is their weight. They are heavy for a b.o.b, but if they keep me alive that's fine. I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Shipment came fast.Saving for emergencies.The bars are pretty dense and compact good for hiking or camping.
customer_reviews.author: chaney yu

customer_reviews.title: Essential back up food
customer_reviews.text: Haven't opened to try, but I have comfort in knowing this is my backup food supply for emergency situations
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid blocks of emergency food
customer_reviews.text: Rations are as described. I got the 2 pack, 1 each of cinnamon and coconut. They are both a solid, sealed block of food. These arrived being only 2 months old, so I will get the full 5 year shelf life. I haven’t eaten any yet and really don’t care how well the taste. They are emergency only for me.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great recorce
customer_reviews.text: Wish the coconut was more pronounced, but over all great to through in your vehicle fir emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: john west

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have with a great taste
customer_reviews.text: I hope to never need them, but they are great to have on hand just in case. Actually taste pretty good and easy to snack on.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Must have for your emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: Throw one in your car, toss one in your go bag and you will always have some food in an emergency. Roughly tastes like a sugar cookie.
customer_reviews.author: Theo13

customer_reviews.title: Lifesavers
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, lasts for a long time. Great taste and easy to pack. I am diabetic and use these for low blood sugar levels when in the field. The high calorie / sugar content is great for unexpected lows.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrel Bifano

customer_reviews.title: Current production...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 10/2020 and received product manufactured 07/2020 expiring in 2025. Shipping current production, which is nice (and expected). Arrived well packaged, no damage. Should serve it's purpose if that time comes, but I'd be just as happy letting it expire.
customer_reviews.author: BenchTest

customer_reviews.title: Great and new
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried them yet but they arrived super quickly and were JUST manufactured last month which, of course, automatically guarantees 5 years of shelf life.
customer_reviews.author: Yope Mingey

customer_reviews.title: Received package as described; hope food-brick tastes decent!
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and compact, and smaller than I expected -- though truthfully I didn't know what to expect. Very compact and seems like a smart emergency ration to have around since it provides a few days worth of sustenance in a fairly compact package that hopefully stores well [it should]. If I ever end up eating them -- probably will try them someday -- I'll update.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Pure Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The ingredients in these bars are pure garbage . Emergency food is right ! But when you’re desperate I suppose you’ll eat anything . As someone said I hope we never these, but we got them just in case .
customer_reviews.author: Dee Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Bars inside are not individually sealed.
customer_reviews.text: Solid purchase. One thing to note is that the bars inside the bag are not individually sealed, they are wrapped in a celophane, but once the outer package is opened they are all open.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Olivas

customer_reviews.title: It has the texture of sand in you mouth ,like eating dirt floating in water.
customer_reviews.text: It has the texture of sand in you mouth ,like eating dirt floating in water. All bars are exposed when you open the package, it would be better suited if they were wrapped individually. What is a thickness rating ?
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Good value and fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these bars for awhile now, as they're the best value/calories I could find for the money. As a reference, my local Wal-Mart sells 2400 calorie packs for 4.99 each. Seller was fast in getting this out. 5 year shelf life and 2018 package date.
customer_reviews.author: Jared C.

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I have kept these on hand for many many years. If stored properly, like in a pantry, shelf life is easily eight years.I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ROB W.

customer_reviews.title: Each Cube Will Keep You Alive For 3 Days
customer_reviews.text: Just buy a cube or two and put in your Go-Bag. These are for the worst of situations. With your 18 packets of water, you will at least be alive to tell the story.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting emergency bars.
customer_reviews.text: Flavors are one of the best for emergency bars. I have now put these in my families 72 hour emergency kits. They are compact enough to carry and store in the cupboard. Also the vacuum seal makes it have a longer storage date. Very glad I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just like a cookie
customer_reviews.text: I ordered several of these for my emergency kit. I opened up a package of the coconut flavored bars and shared them at work. Everyone was pleasantly surprised at how edible they were, just like a cookie. They are very sugary and the individually wrapped bars are quite oily but this will be the least of my worries in a survival situation.
customer_reviews.author: KNA

customer_reviews.title: Good way to stay prepared
customer_reviews.text: I believe that it is good to have some compacted food available.
customer_reviews.author: LDSaint

customer_reviews.title: Bars are NOT individually wrapped...
customer_reviews.text: Verry upset about packaging. Came vac sealed and the bars weren't broken but they were NOT individually packaged. Doesn't taste bad at all. Most definitely not the healthiest but in any situation food is food.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: soy
customer_reviews.text: boo hiss. this was overpriced. and has soy, which I cant digest..
customer_reviews.author: TexasTripletMom

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be ok. Wont really know unless there is an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: Donna H.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Great Product for the price. Thank You Harrison / Nam Era Vet / Patron Life NRA / AUSA / Life VFW / Gold Star Family Member .armymillard.com / Others
customer_reviews.author: OldSchoolCollector

customer_reviews.title: Im sure it's great
customer_reviews.text: Please stop asking me to rate this. I didn't buy EMERGENCY ration bars just to snack on like a candy bar. I don't know how they taste because I received them and put them away. All I can say is the vacuum seal seemed in tact
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: I have these for hiking or whenever I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Templeladee

customer_reviews.title: Necessary back up
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t tried these yet and I probably won’t unless I have to. Just on standby as back up
customer_reviews.author: Scrubtech

customer_reviews.title: Well packaged! Great for emergency stash!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for emergency preparedness so u haven’t opened or tried them yet. I can’t comment on the taste but the package was tightly sealed and I’m excited about the crazy amount of protein in them!
customer_reviews.author: Allison M. Liwosz

customer_reviews.title: Good food can save your life in an emergency! Thank you
customer_reviews.text: Good food can save your life in an emergency! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: wei Ding

customer_reviews.title: Kinda dry
customer_reviews.text: I guess if i was straving and i had no other choice i would eat it..
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the vehicle or day excursions
customer_reviews.text: Taste great! Don’t make you thirsty. Will be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Garner

customer_reviews.title: seem well packaged
customer_reviews.text: Arrived intact. Hard to rate these, since they are kept as emergency rations. Opening up for a taste would expose them all to the air- packaged in a vacuum packed lump. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Useful!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to try out and give a review, this product is useful for emergencies and the taste is ok. Just remember I would advise to drink water if you consume it is a dry bar much like what some of us in the Military would call the John Wayne bar.
customer_reviews.author: Dru

customer_reviews.title: Quality packaging. I actually kind of liked the taste, which makes survival situations a little more bearable.
customer_reviews.text: Quality packaging. And, I ordered an extra so that I could taste it and make sure this wasn't something that would make me sick to my stomach if I ever needed to use it. It was actually kind of good. So, sealed well. Compact, emergency calories. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: James Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Did a test. 3 bars a day with morning ...
customer_reviews.text: Did a test. 3 bars a day with morning weight training for 6 days. 1 pack lasts about 3 days. I lost body fat but also don't feel weak and able to exercise. The only thing i noticed was a high dehydration from it. So make sure to drink enough water.
customer_reviews.author: n.n.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for go bag or survival kit.
customer_reviews.text: Good size, individually wrapped. Great for survival rations. Also they don't taste too bad, but not that great either so I don't have to worry about eating them too quickly. 1.6lb per 3day pack. Also they have a 5-year shelf life.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: These are heavy!
customer_reviews.text: Everything was as I expected but one thing I didn’t take into account was the weight of these things. I put 3days worth in my BOB and it was like putting a dumbbell in there. Seriously it’s like adding a brick to your bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good rations for a rainy day
customer_reviews.text: Excellent combo pack if emergency rations to keep the palate changing when sitting around and doing nothing. These rations are not exactly great for bug out/active use, but will certainly work well in low intensity situations such as the lifeboat for which they were designed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Doerr

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Items arrived as described and on time. Date of Manufacture was within 2 months at the time of ordering. I purchased these bars to store in my car in case of an emergency. Even though the bars are stored in a vacuum sealed pouch, I put them in a gallon size zip lock bag. That way, if I ever need to open them, I can keep them in the ziplock.
customer_reviews.author: T_Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Quality product with long shelf life remaining.
customer_reviews.text: Compact food source for a go bag. I am please It was made only one month before I receive it, so it still has 4 years and 11 months left before the expiration date.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: emergecy food.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Hurricane season, in case the power goes out for a coupla days. There's 9 bars in each foil pack and expiration date is 2023. Have not tasted yet.
customer_reviews.author: Heavymetaltrax

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully I never need them but it is good peace of
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t tasted these, but they came well packaged and sealed appropriately. I am keeping them as part of my emergency kit. Hopefully I never need them but it is good peace of mind
customer_reviews.author: Mrs_S

customer_reviews.title: One with broken seal
customer_reviews.text: One of my food bars packages came with a broken vaccum seal and had crumb
customer_reviews.author: Julian Galarza

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: I have many of these stashed away with my emergency supplies. I haven’t tried them yet, but they are very compact and packed with calories, which is what I’m looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As long as they keep me alive for smashing flakes!
customer_reviews.text: Small and compact, I ain't ate them yet, as I have had no reason to. I really don't give a dadgum what the heck they taste like, as long as they keep me alive when the SHTF.
customer_reviews.author: BevinKuckridge

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. Great shelf life for our go bag. Manufacturing date only a month or two old, so most of the five year shelf life in tact.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jansen

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived quickly and on time. The emergency food is wrapped tightly and well sealed. 5 yr expiration date as promised. Very satisfied! Fair price too!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous1

customer_reviews.title: Very happy 😄
customer_reviews.text: This is sealed in plastic, nutrition contents on front... very happy to have this,not tried yet.. good for years and years!! Get some!
customer_reviews.author: miss maine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Manufactured last month, good for 5 years. That's about as fresh off the line I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for survival
customer_reviews.text: Food showed up with a very recent manufactured date. this will give me a very good shelf life. I got the combo pack for my bugout bags. keep in mind these are very dense and deceptively heavy for their size.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good taste and very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that I could put in my truck for emergencies. These bars had the best reviews on taste so I decided to try them. They were so much better than I thought they would be especially the cinnamon. My whole family tried them and they all said that they would eat them in an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great rations
customer_reviews.text: Ordered both, haven't tried the coconut. The cinnamon I'll reorder several. I lead a search and rescue team and these are great and tasty survival rations. I actually ate thru the brick as breakfast and quite enjoyed them
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: perfect for emergency
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe that many calories can fit in this tiny bar. Perfect for keeping in the car or in a 72 hour kit.
customer_reviews.author: K. Aston

product_meta.title: S.O.S. Rations Emergency 3600 Calorie Food Bar (Cinnamon + Coconut, 2 Pack)
product_meta.description: Size:Cinnamon + Coconut15, 075 KJ. 3600 kcal per package. High energy value. Ready to eat. Perfect for anyone in the process of building a disaster/ emergency kit. The SOS emergency food rations are US Coast guard approved and has a shelf life of 5 years from the date of manufacture. Content: Each package contains 9 delicious bars providing 410 calories per bar totaling over 3600 calories per package. Non-thirst provoking Formula offers maximum survival capacity with drinking water restriction under all environmental conditions. Directions: Eat three food bars per person per day.
feature_bullets: Each packet contains 9 fortified food bars providing 3682 Kcal (15, 460 KJ)
US Coast Guard approved for 5 year shelf life under all climatic conditions
Designed to sustain life until rescue or additional food is available
Great coconut flavor, non-thirst provoking formula.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars566 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
